title: Simulation-Based Language Material Management Training for Digital Library and Repository Construction

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced digital library theory, advanced metadata techniques, and understanding of basic linguistic classification systems
context.additional_context: Practical training through smartphone-based VR simulations, focusing on enhancing learners’ text analysis and digital resource management competencies.

learning_goals: Learners explain the basic components and operational processes of a digital library and understand systematic classification and preservation methods for language materials.

Learners accurately complete ≥90% of digital library standard metadata fields (five mandatory fields: author, title, publication year, subject keywords, language) in a VR simulation environment and complete the procedure of uploading three or more digital language materials to the designated platform.
Learners establish a plan for building a small-scale digital repository through team projects and propose strategies for integrated management of multilingual materials.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
